Simulator¶

Classes:

SimProblem()

A Petri net in which: - arcs are ordered - functions are part of the transition - delays are part of the transition
class simpn.simulator.SimProblem¶

A Petri net in which: - arcs are ordered - functions are part of the transition - delays are part of the transition

Methods:

bindings()

Calculates the set of timed bindings that is enabled in the net.

fire(timed_binding[, callback])

Fires the specified timed binding.

transition_bindings(transition)

Calculates the set of bindings that enables the given transition.
bindings()¶

Calculates the set of timed bindings that is enabled in the net. Each binding is a tuple ([(place, token), (place, token), …], time) that represents a single enabling binding. If no timed binding is enabled at the current clock time, updates the current clock time to the earliest time at which there is. :return: list of tuples ([(place, token), (place, token), …], time, transition)

fire(timed_binding, callback=None)¶

Fires the specified timed binding. Binding is a tuple ([(place, token), (place, token), …], time, transition)

transition_bindings(transition)¶

Calculates the set of bindings that enables the given transition. Each binding is a list of lists of (place, token value) pairs, in which each list of pairs represents a single enabling binding. :param transition: the transition for which to calculate the enabling bindings. :return: a list of lists of (place, token value) pairs
